18225293.admreg: Europe and Central Asia,Europe and Central Asia
18225293.theme: Export development and competitiveness,Other financial and private sector development

abstracts.cdata!:
The Pre-Export Guarantee Facility
            Project has been designed to attract foreign private finance
            for pre-export transactions in a manner that will allow the
            market to select the most viable activities and bear the
            full commercial risk of each transaction. A Guarantee
            Administration Unit (GAU) will sell guarantees against
            government performance and political force majeure risks.
            These guarantees will be sold on a first come, first served
            basis to foreign input suppliers, trading companies, or
            financial institutions that finance the provision of inputs
            to local Moldovan enterprises. Through an agent bank to be
            hired by the GAU, a standby World Bank loan facility will
            backstop the Government's claims payment obligations on
            up to $30 million of GAU guarantees outstanding at any given time.
